sentences.english: A lord regarded as immature or insignificant.
sentences.chinese: 这位老爷爷很小的时候就入了村塾。

sentences.english: This old man entered a village school when he was very young.
sentences.chinese: 这位老爷爷很小的时候就入了村塾。

definition: candidate who has not yet passed the county level imperial exam
to advance one's learning/to enter the prefecture school under the imperial examination system
Imperial College of Supreme Learning, established in 124 BC, and the highest educational institute in ancient China until the Sui Dynasty
Imperial College (or Academy), the highest educational body in imperial China
Imperial Hanlin Academy, lasting from Tang dynasty until 1911
scholar preparing for imperial examinations (in former times)
a person who has passed the county level imperial exam (historical)/scholar/skillful writer/fine talent
autumn exam (triennial provincial exam during Ming and Qing)
